9.7. Nonblocking Neighborhood Communication on Process Topologies


Up: Virtual Topologies for MPI Processes Next: Nonblocking Neighborhood Gather Previous: Neighborhood Alltoall

Nonblocking variants of the neighborhood collective operations allow relaxed synchronization and overlapping of computation and communication. The semantics are similar to nonblocking collective operations as described in Section Nonblocking Collective Operations.


Up: Virtual Topologies for MPI Processes Next: Nonblocking Neighborhood Gather Previous: Neighborhood Alltoall
